chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
Y: Type
X: Type
f: X -> Y
g: Y -> X
f_inj: injective f
g_inj: injective g

Goal:
exists h : X -> Y, bijective h

Premises:
injective = fun (U V : Type) (f : U -> V) => forall x y : U, f x = f y -> x = y : forall U V : Type, (U -> V) -> Prop Arguments injective {U V}%type_scope _%function_scope
bijective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => injective f /\ surjective f : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments bijective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
invertible_impl_bijective : forall f0 : ?X -> ?Y, invertible f0 -> bijective f0 where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type] ?Y : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type]
bijective_impl_invertible : forall f0 : ?X -> ?Y, bijective f0 -> invertible f0 where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type] ?Y : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type]
intro_invertible : forall (f0 : ?X -> ?Y) (g0 : ?Y -> ?X), (forall x : ?X, g0 (f0 x) = x) -> (forall y : ?Y, f0 (g0 y) = y) -> invertible f0 where ?X : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type] ?Y : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y g : Y -> X f_inj : injective f g_inj : injective g |- Type]
surjective = fun (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) => forall y : Y, exists x : X, f x = y : forall X Y : Type, (X -> Y) -> Prop Arguments surjective {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive invertible (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) : Prop := intro_invertible : forall g : Y -> X, (forall x : X, g (f x) = x) -> (forall y : Y, f (g y) = y) -> invertible f Arguments invertible {X Y}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_invertible {X Y}%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope
Im_inv : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (y : V), In V (Im U V X f) y -> exists x : U, In U X x /\ f x = y
not_injective_elim : forall (U V : Type) (f : U -> V), ~ injective f -> exists x y : U, f x = f y /\ x <> y
cardinal_unicity : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (n : nat), cardinal U X n -> forall m : nat, cardinal U X m -> n = m
In_Image_elim : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V), injective f -> forall x : U, In V (Im U V A f) (f x) -> In U A x
Inductive Im (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) : Ensemble V := Im_intro : forall x : U, In U X x -> forall y : V, y = f x -> In V (Im U V X f) y Arguments Im (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope Arguments Im_intro (_ _)%type_scope _ _%function_scope
injective_preserves_cardinal : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), injective f -> cardinal U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) n' -> n' = n
Pigeonhole : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), cardinal U A n -> forall n' : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) n' -> n' < n -> ~ injective f
Im_add : forall (U V : Type) (X : Ensemble U) (x : U) (f : U -> V), Im U V (Add U X x) f = Add V (Im U V X f) (f x)
Inductive Zis_gcd (a b g : BinNums.Z) : Prop := Zis_gcd_intro : BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro (_ _ _)%Z_scope _ _ _%function_scope
ChoiceFacts.IndependenceOfGeneralPremises = forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (Q : Prop), inhabited A -> (Q -> exists x : A, P x) -> exists x : A, Q -> P x : Prop
ChoiceFacts.GuardedFunctionalChoice_on = fun A B : Type => forall (P : A -> Prop) (R : A -> B -> Prop), inhabited B -> (forall x : A, P x -> exists y : B, R x y) -> exists f : A -> B, forall x : A, P x -> R x (f x) : Type -> Type -> Prop Arguments ChoiceFacts.GuardedFunctionalChoice_on (_ _)%type_scope
BinInt.Z.Bezout = fun n m p : BinNums.Z => exists a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul a n) (BinInt.Z.mul b m) = p : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop
not_all_not_ex : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop), ~ (forall n : U, ~ P n) -> exists n : U, P n
not_all_ex_not : forall (U : Type) (P : U -> Prop), ~ (forall n : U, P n) -> exists n : U, ~ P n
Empty_set_minimal : forall (U : Type) (X : Ensemble U), Included U (Empty_set U) X
cardinal_Im_intro : forall (U V : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (f : U -> V) (n : nat), cardinal U A n -> exists p : nat, cardinal V (Im U V A f) p
BinNat.N.log2_up_eq_succ_is_pow2 : forall a : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.log2_up (BinNat.N.succ a) = BinNat.N.succ (BinNat.N.log2_up a) -> exists b : BinNums.N, a = BinNat.N.pow (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) b
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
EnvRing.Pphi : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> Env.Env R -> EnvRing.Pol C -> R
Inductive uint : Set := Nil : Decimal.uint | D0 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D1 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D2 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D3 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D4 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D5 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D6 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D7 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D8 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint | D9 : Decimal.uint -> Decimal.uint
EnvRing.PmulC_aux : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> C -> EnvRing.Pol C
EnvRing.mkPX : forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> EnvRing.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> EnvRing.Pol C -> EnvRing.Pol C
Ring_polynom.PExpr_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Prop), P Ring_polynom.PEO -> P Ring_polynom.PEI -> (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.PEc c)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P (Ring_polynom.PEX C p)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEadd p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEsub p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p -> forall p0 : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.PEmul p p0)) ->...-> forall p : Ring_polynom.PExpr C, P p
ssrunder.Under_rel.Under_rel : forall A : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> A -> A -> Prop
